content.webTitle: How do acorns that fall to the ground bury themselves below the surface?

fields.headline: How do acorns that fall to the ground bury themselves below the surface?
fields.bodyText: When acorns fall off my oak tree in the autumn they naturally settle on top of the soil. But when spring comes, I find they have germinated and are shooting up – but from their new positions of 2-3 inches below the surface. How on earth did they get down there? Pete Hanson, Exeter Post your answers – and new questions – below or email them to nq@theguardian.com
